abstract.text: Find the protocol version that corresponds with the HLS features your app supports.

inlineContent.text: tag indicates the compatibility version of the Playlist file.
This file, its associated media, and its server must comply with all provisions of
describing the protocol version indicated by the tag value. A Playlist file that
tag must comply with version 1 of this protocol.
Support for M3U8 Playlists was introduced with iOS 3.0, Mac OS X 10.6, and Safari
Older clients ignore backward-compatible features and will still play
back the content in some form. Specify only the protocol version that’s required
for backward compatibility in a given feature. For example, you don’t have to specify
protocol version 5 if you’ve just added SUBTITLES.
The following features aren’t backward compatible. Older clients may fail to play
the content if you use these features but don’t specify the protocol version where
You must use at least protocol version 2 if you have
You must use at least protocol version 3 if you have floating point
You must use at least protocol version 4 if you have
You must use at least protocol version 5 if you specify the
You must use at least protocol version 6 if you have
You must use at least protocol version 7 if you specify
You must use at least protocol version 8 if you use variable substitution.
You must use at least protocol version 9 if you have
You must use at least protocol version 10 if you have
You must use at least protocol version 11 if you have
You must use at least protocol version 12 if you have attributes that start with  “
The following tables list the versions of specifications where specific features
are described, along with the corresponding iOS release that supports those features.

floating point durations. Support for CEA-608 Closed captions.
to be used in subtitle playlists.
. Added support for Enhanced AC-3. Support for CEA-708 Closed captions.
for non-MPEG-2 content. Added semantic change for
tag. Updated the JSON RFC format requirement.
tag. Minor clarification about the use of Movie Extends Box in Fragmented MPEG-4 files.
Add note about PES timestamp wraps.
Revise definition of peak segment bit rate. Add
. Allow Media Metadata tags to be removed from playlists.
Rearranged Playlist Tags subsections. Minor rewording.
. Support for Low-Latency HLS, including Partial Segments, Delivery Directives, Playlist Delta Updates, and the Low-Latency Server Configuration Profile. Adds tags:
attribute. Reserves query parameters that begin with “
values are Media Characteristic Tags, not Uniform Type Identifiers. A few minor clarifications.
Minor clarifications. Preload hint request should use 2^53-1 for unknown byte range length.
Rename to “Multivariant Playlist”. Add Content Steering (
attribute, and fetching Steering Manifests). Add Interstitials (specialized
tags, asset list interstitial JSON files, and the enumerated-string-list type). Minor clarifications.
Update Content Steering to add Pathway Cloning. Add
. Modify rules for Partial Segments near
. Add special behavior for attributes with a prefix of “
to allow a third parameter.  Added
.  Added mention of the extensible priority scheme.  Added appendix on “Displaying Rendition Names”. Minor clarifications.

abstract.text: Send audio and video to iOS, tvOS, and macOS devices.
View and compare playlists for different HLS applications.
